topics.title: Ischemic Heart Disease
keyPoints: Risk factors: HTN, DM, smoking, dyslipidemia, family history
Clinical presentation: Chest pain, dyspnea, diaphoresis
Diagnosis: ECG changes, cardiac biomarkers (Troponin), coronary angiography
Management: MONA (Morphine, Oxygen, Nitrates, Aspirin), PCI, CABG
Secondary prevention: Dual antiplatelet therapy, statins, ACE inhibitors

mnemonics.MONA: Initial management of MI - Morphine, Oxygen, Nitrates, Aspirin
mnemonics.HEART: Risk stratification - History, ECG, Age, Risk factors, Troponin

practiceQuestions.question: A 55-year-old male presents with crushing chest pain radiating to left arm for 2 hours. ECG shows ST elevation in leads II, III, aVF. What is the most likely diagnosis?
practiceQuestions.explanation: ST elevation in leads II, III, aVF indicates inferior wall myocardial infarction, typically due to right coronary artery occlusion.

topics.title: Heart Failure
keyPoints: Classification: Systolic (HFrEF) vs Diastolic (HFpEF)
NYHA functional classification: I-IV based on symptoms
Diagnosis: Clinical + Echo (EF assessment) + BNP/NT-proBNP
Management: ACE-I/ARB, Beta-blockers, Diuretics, Aldosterone antagonists
Advanced: CRT, ICD, LVAD, heart transplant

mnemonics.FACES: Common causes - Failure (pump), Arrhythmia, Coronary, Endocrine, Septal defects

topics.title: Asthma
keyPoints: Reversible airway obstruction with bronchial hyperresponsiveness
Triggers: Allergens, exercise, cold air, infections, NSAIDs
Diagnosis: Spirometry (FEV1/FVC <70%, reversibility >12%)
Step-wise management: SABA → ICS → LABA + ICS → add-ons
Acute exacerbation: Oxygen, nebulized bronchodilators, steroids

mnemonics.ASTHMA: Triggers - Allergens, Smoke, Temperature, Hormones, Meds, Activity

topics.title: Peptic Ulcer Disease
keyPoints: Causes: H. pylori (most common), NSAIDs, stress
DU: Pain 2-3 hrs after meals, relieved by food
GU: Pain worsened by food
Diagnosis: Endoscopy with biopsy, H. pylori testing
Treatment: PPI + H. pylori eradication (triple/quadruple therapy)

mnemonics.GASTRIC: Causes of ulcers - Gastrinoma, Aspirin/NSAIDs, Smoking, Trauma, Reflux, Infection (H. pylori), Corticosteroids
